contents.tooltip: When you see something disturbing, or the GM says you do, roll for Stress. :: Whenever your Stress increases, say how the increased Stress manifests. :: When Stress reaches 6, you choose to either describe what happens as you crack and become an NPC under the sway of the Conspiracy, or describe how you die, perhaps heroically. Either way … start a new character.
Looks ‘suspiciously burdened’ :: Limited to gear rated (■) or (■■) :: risks more frequent challenges to maintain their cover
Looks ‘suspiciously burdened’ :: Limited to gear rated (■) or (■■) :: risks more frequent challenges to maintain their cover

Looks like they are professionals on a mission :: Can declare any gear: (■), (■■), (■■■), or (■■■■) :: Can't use Expertise to "maintain their cover" or [flee for their life and chase them down], on foot

Looks like they are professionals on a mission :: Can declare any gear: (■), (■■), (■■■), or (■■■■) :: Can't use Expertise to "maintain their cover" or [flee for their life and chase them down], on foot
Some Expertise will require you to have a particular piece of equipment.  Just because you have expertise in Digital Intrusion doesn't mean you can work without a laptop/tablet ...
Once per Cycle of Play mark Stress to use your specialism to improve the outcome of a dice roll by one step so long as the action made use of that specific Expertise and the GM agrees.
Some Expertise requires particular Equipment. Just because you have Digital Intrustion expertise doesn't mean you won't need to load up with a Computer ...

contents.value:
You have False Papers, secure personal comms & a Knapsack/Bag unless you say you don't.
Pick other gear as needed, up to your limit:
When you want to ask a question about someone, something or somewhere, or want Control to reveal something about the situation.
If you fight or shoot at a threat or they attack you, say what success looks like: Hurt them; Subdue them; Avoid their attempt to hurt you; Some other outcome.
When you do something that isn't covered by another move, say what success looks like and roll.
When you are at risk of exposure, say how you brazen it out, avoid detection or hide from those who suspect you, or are looking for you.
When you want to escape your fate by leaving the scene and Control agrees there’s a reasonable route by which you could get away.
When they are getting away and Control agrees there’s a reasonable way for you to catch them before they escape, and their Powers don’t make it impossible.

When the fiction allows choose one of the options,
immediately reduce Stress by 1, and roll 1d6 to discover the consequences:
If you verbally or physically abuse someone, or chat them up for meaningless sex…
If you get drunk, get high, gamble or indulge another destructive vice…
If you seek the advice of a mentor, confidante or someone you trust…

If you say something new about your Anchor and describe:
  • Where they live
  • What they do
  • Who their friends are and how they socialise
  • How they reassured you they cared once
  • What happened the last time you met that strained the relationship.
  • Why we should care about them or what makes them a sympathetic character.
1+, mark your Anchor, placing them on the Conspiracy Target list, or Missing if they are already a Target. Only Control can mark Taken.
Reveal some of your history together

If you reveal something new about your history with one of your key relationships in the team, describe:
  • Your first recollection of them
  • A time you saved them
  • A time they saved you
  • When it went sour or confirmed your friendship
  • Your first encounter with the supernatural together
  • Any other event involving them that illustrates your history and throws more light on your current relationship.

contents.label: Describe yourself as others see you:

options.key: You did what benefitted the boss, made money
You protected the state from threats both foreign & domestic
You upheld the laws of your nation
You listened in to the opposition

contents.tooltip: Domestic Intelligence: [British MI5, Bulgarian NIS, German BfV, Iranian VEVAK, Russian FSB, United States FBI] // Foreign Intelligence: [British MI6, Bulgarian NIS, French DGSE, German BND, Israeli Mossad, Russian GRU, United States CIA] // Law Enforcement: [British Special Branch, French Surete, German Bundespolizei, Italian Carabinieri, Spanish Customs, United States FBI] // Signals Intelligence: [British GCHQ, Israeli Unit 8200, United States NSA] // Tactical Intervention: [British SAS, German GSG9] // Criminal: [Neapolitan Camorra, New IRA, Russian Lisky Bratva, Serbian Nasa Stvar]

contents.value: Why did you choose to confront the Conspiracy?

options.key: What did you do for the Conspiracy that you are ashamed of and haven’t shared with anyone yet? How could the Conspiracy entice you back into the fold?
options.value: Betrayal: you were a cog in the Conspiracy machine, then you were betrayed.

options.key: What have you seen that fuels your fascination with the Conspiracy? What would you give up to know more about them?
options.value: Curiosity: you are fascinated by the allure of the blasphemous unknown.

options.key: What happened that confirmed the Conspiracy as a worthy challenge? What would you risk for the rush you crave in your pursuit of the Conspiracy?
options.value: Excitement: you live for the sheer unadulterated adrenaline rush of the chase.

options.key: What do you believe in and how has the Conspiracy threatened your beliefs? What would it take for you to discard your beliefs?
options.value: Faith: you believe in something that drives you but that the Conspiracy threatens.

options.key: What have you seen that demonstrates the Conspiracy’s wealth &/or power? What could they tempt you with?
options.value: Greed: you like the good things, and this life sometimes delivers them.

options.key: What have you seen that demonstrated the Conspiracy's inhumanity? What would you sacrifice to stop them?
options.value: Humanity: when you found out what they were doing you had to get involved.

options.key: Who was it and what were the circumstances? If you haven’t seen their body, or perhaps even if you have, what would you do to get them back?
options.value: Loss: they took someone that mattered from you.

options.key: What was the most important thing you lost and how did they take it from you? What did they do? What would your sacrifice to get your revenge?
options.value: Revenge: they destroyed the life you had.

contents.tooltip: This is the person you need to protect from the conspiracy.

contents.label: Reveal things when the rules tell you to:

contents.value: Which member of the team do you care most about?
Reveal a piece of the history you share with them when the rules tell you to
Which member of the team do you care least about?
Reveal a piece of the history you share with them when the rules tell you to
What single thing reassures you most that this place is safe?
Which single GEAR BENEFIT does it offer?
